page.title: 08ASPECTS OF FAMILY LIFE (2)
page.content: HOME LIFE IN A VILLAGE OR RURAL COMMUNITY FREQUENTLY REVOLVES AROUND THE FAMILY KITCHEN WHERE MOTHER MAY BE PREPARING A MEAL OF FRESHLY GATHERED PRODUCE WHICH FATHER HAS GROWN IN HIS GARDEN OR ON AN ALLOTMENT (FOR WHICH HE PAYS A NOMINAL RENT TO THE PARISH COUNCIL OR THE EARL SPENCER IN THE CASE OF CHAPEL BRAMPTON). THERE IS ONLY MODERATE USE OF WHAT IS COMMONLY CALLED CONVENIENCE FOOD BECAUSE OF ITS LIMITED AVAILABILITY IN THE AREA. FAST FOOD OUTLETS ARE TOTALLY ABSENT FROM THESE COMMUNITIES. THE MAIN MEAL OF THE DAY IS OFTEN THE EVENING ONE AS THE OLDER CHILDREN AND FATHER MAY BE ASENT AT LUNCH-TIME. A TYPICAL DINNER (MAIN MEAL) MAY CONSIST OF THREE COURSES - A MAIN COURSE OF MEAT OR FISH, POTATOES AND VEGETABLES; A SWEET COURSE OF PUDDING, FRUIT OR CAKE; AND COFFEE, WITH EXTRA ON SUNDAY
